Yola Kema
poet. and other, things.
Apr 11

Like a Book

He knew everything, and then left.

He spread me open like a book,

And left a bookmark where he’d been,

Where he’d last been and what he read,

He still, concentrating, feeling,

He was internalising, memorising,

The images, I’d put together,

He opened me, and he saw through my words,

then he, said he’d, bought it,

He spread me like a book, and left me,

Wide open, on the counter.
